isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: ROCKWELL WABCO 4 CHANNEL - TROUBLESHOOTING - OPTIONAL TEST EQUIPMENT

warning.para: Exhaust gas contains poison. When testing a vehicle with the engine running, test in a well ventilated area or route the exhaust fumes outside. To avoid personal injury and damage to test equipment, keep away from moving or hot engine parts.Block the wheels of the vehicle and be sure the transmission is in neutral.

caution.para: When troubleshooting or testing the ABS at the main connector on the ECU, be careful not to damage the electrical socket.

svcprocinfo.para: The Wabco test adapter can be used to measure the resistance across the harness pins.

svcsubproc.title: Volt-Ohm Meter (VOM)
svcsubproc.para: The receptacles in the Wabco test adapter accept the tips of standard VOM cables. Use a good quality digital or analog VOM.
A VOM with automatic polarity sensing is recommended. This eliminates worry over polarity of the meter leads during voltage measurements.

step1.para: Determine the failure code and meaning. Refer to BLINK CODE DIAGNOSTIC CHART .
Disconnect the harness connector from the ECU.
Insert the test adapter into the harness connector.
Check the following table Table 1: Test Adapter Measurement Checks, to determine which adapter pins to test with the VOM.
Set the VOM to the appropriate scale.
Take measurement and write it down.
Compare measurements with the desired measurement value listed in Table 1: Test Adapter Measurement Checks .
Repair or replace wiring or components as necessary.
Disconnect the test adapter from the harness and reconnect the harness to the ECU.
Road test the vehicle to make sure the ABS is functional.

caution.para: The following tests could damage the measuring instruments or ABS and/or ATC valves being tested. If you do not know how to use a VOM, do not conduct these tests.
If the VOM is not connected properly, damage to the meter could result. Valves should not be left connected to power (pin 9) for more than 10 seconds or the valve may be damaged.

entry.para: VR1 or VR2 relay contacts sticking
Wiring to ATC diagnostic light interrupted
Broken wire between ECU and sensor Sensor connector
Wiring between ECU and valve interrupted
Wiring between ECU and valve interrupted
* Press Toggle Diagnostic Switch during test.
**Turn wheel by hand at 30 RPM (2 se./rev).

svcsubproc.title: Table 2: ABS and ATC Valve Function Test

item.para: Adhere to the cautions listed for TABLE 1 when performing the following tests.
Always perform the tests in TABLE 1 before attempting the Valve Function Tests in TABLE 2: ABS and ATC Valve Function Test.

svcsubproc.para: The word TOUCH means connect appropriate lead to pin 9 only when ready to observe result.

Conduct the ABS and ATC Valve Function Tests only if the Measurement Checks in TABLE 1 yield inconclusive results. This could occur because of improper plumbing to the ABS or ATC valves or because the wiring to the ABS valves has the inlet and exhaust portion of the solenoid interchanged. In either case, the ECU may not detect the error and it will be necessary to manually activate the valve to confirm correct function.

table.title: Table 2: ABS and ATC Valve Function Test

entry.para: No pressure buildup in LF chamber
No pressure buildup in RF chamber
No pressure buildup in LR chamber
No pressure buildup in RR chamber
Plumbing to ATC valve blocked, incorrect
